reviews.text: The museum offers a great opportunity to deepen our understanding of Iceland's natural environment before starting the tour. It's a pleasant place, usually not overcrowded, allowing for around two hours of engagement, including several impressive shows. The northern lights and lava exhibitions are particularly remarkable.

Really cool place. Almost too much to see and the observation deck is for sure the spot to view the city and beautiful landscape. Floor 5 would be awesome to be in to watch the northern lights in a cozy space.

Visited on the weekend whilst on holiday and really enjoyed the afternoon here. The ice cave was amazing and views over the city from the observation deck were great; if a little windy! Lovely couple of exhibits and just a generally all round good time.

Great visit especially on a rainy day. Set over several floors with a great viewing Dome and restaurant at the top. Large free car parking.  Lots of interactive elements to the visitor especially the ice cave.

Perlan Museum was a fantastic afternoon adventure! The views were stunning, and the interactive exhibits were engaging and educational. The restaurant‚Äôs location was a highlight, offering delicious food with a great ambiance. My friends and I had a blast and learned so much. Highly recommend! üåüüèûÔ∏èüçΩÔ∏è

Enjoy sharing those memories!
